app.schemas package¶

Submodules¶

app.schemas.collection_delete_schema module¶

This module defines Pydantic schemas for handling the deletion of a collection.

class app.schemas.collection_delete_schema.CollectionDeleteResponse(*, collection_id: int)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Response schema for the successful deletion of a collection. Contains the collection’s unique identifier that confirms the deletion was applied to the specific collection record.

collection_id: int¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

app.schemas.collection_insert_schema module¶

The module defines Pydantic schemas for the creation and response of collections.

class app.schemas.collection_insert_schema.CollectionInsertRequest(*, collection_name: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=1), MaxLen(max_length=79)], collection_summary: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=4095)] = None)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Request schema for creating a new collection. It includes the collection name, which must be between 2 and 79 characters, and an optional summary for the collection, which can be up to 1023 characters. The fields are validated and cleaned before being processed.

class Config[source]¶

Bases: object

Strips whitespaces at the beginning and end of all values.

str_strip_whitespace = True¶

app.schemas.collection_list_schema module¶

This module defines Pydantic schemas for listing collections.

class app.schemas.collection_list_schema.CollectionListRequest(*, user_id__eq: int | None = None, offset: Annotated[int | None, Ge(ge=0)] = None, limit: Annotated[int | None, Ge(ge=1)] = None, order_by: Literal['id', 'user_id', 'collection_name_index', 'documents_count'] | None = None, order: Literal['asc', 'desc', 'rand'] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Request schema for listing collections with pagination and filtering options. Includes an optional filter by user, pagination parameters like offset and limit, the field to order the results by, and the direction of ordering. The order direction can be ascending, descending, or random.

app.schemas.token_retrieve_schema module¶

The module defines Pydantic schemas for retrieving a user token.

class app.schemas.token_retrieve_schema.TokenRetrieveRequest(*, username: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=47)], user_totp: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=6), MaxLen(max_length=6)], token_exp: Annotated[int | None, Ge(ge=1)] = None)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Request schema for retrieving a user token. Contains the username, the time-based one-time password for multi-factor authentication, and an optional token expiration time. The totp must be a 6-digit numeric value. If provided, it indicates the desired expiration time of the token.

class app.schemas.user_login_schema.UserLoginRequest(*, username: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=47)], password: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=6)])[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Request schema for logging in a user. Contains the username and password fields. The username is converted to lowercase before being processed. The password field has a minimum length of 6 characters and.

app.schemas.user_password_schema module¶

The module defines Pydantic schemas for changing a user’s password.

class app.schemas.user_password_schema.UserPasswordRequest(*, current_password: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=6)], updated_password: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=6)])[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Request schema for updating a user’s password. Contains the current password and the new password. The updated password must meet specific security requirements: it must contain at least one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter, one digit, and one special character. Both passwords have a minimum length of 6 characters.

current_password: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

updated_password: str¶
classmethod validate_updated_password(updated_password: str) → str[source]¶

Password must contain at least one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter, one digit, and one special character.

class app.schemas.user_password_schema.UserPasswordResponse(*, user_id: int)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Response schema for the successful update of a user’s password. Contains the user’s unique identifier that confirms the password was updated for the specific user record.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

user_id: int¶

app.schemas.user_register_schema module¶

The module defines Pydantic schemas for user registration.

class app.schemas.user_register_schema.UserRegisterRequest(*, username: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=2), MaxLen(max_length=47)], password: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=6)], first_name: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=1), MaxLen(max_length=47)], last_name: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=1), MaxLen(max_length=47)], user_summary: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=4095)] = None)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Request schema for registering a new user. Contains required fields for user registration including username, password, first name, last name, and an optional user summary. The username must consist of only latin letters and numbers. The password must contain at least one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter, one digit, one special character, and no spaces.

class Config[source]¶

Bases: object

Strips whitespaces at the beginning and end of all values.

app.schemas.user_role_schema module¶

The module defines Pydantic schemas for changing a user’s role and activity status.

class app.schemas.user_role_schema.UserRoleRequest(*, user_role: Literal['reader', 'writer', 'editor', 'admin'], is_active: bool)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Request schema for updating a user’s role and activity status. Contains the new role for the user and a boolean flag indicating whether the user is active or not. The user role must be one of the following: “reader”, “writer”, “editor”, or “admin”.

is_active: bool¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

user_role: Literal['reader', 'writer', 'editor', 'admin']¶

app.schemas.user_select_schema module¶

The module defines Pydantic schemas for selecting and retrieving user details.

class app.schemas.user_select_schema.UserSelectResponse(*, id: int, created_date: int, username: str, first_name: str, last_name: str, user_role: Literal['reader', 'writer', 'editor', 'admin'], is_active: bool, user_summary: str | None = None, userpic_filename: str | None = None, user_meta: dict)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Response schema for selecting a user’s details. Contains information about a user, including their unique identifier, creation date, username, first and last names, role within the app, active status, and optional fields like user summary and profile picture URL. This schema is used to return user details when querying the user record.

created_date: int¶
first_name: str¶
id: int¶
is_active: bool¶
last_name: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

user_meta: dict¶
user_role: Literal['reader', 'writer', 'editor', 'admin']¶
user_summary: str | None¶
username: str¶

app.schemas.user_update_schema module¶

The module defines Pydantic schemas for user registration and updating user information.

class app.schemas.user_update_schema.UserUpdateRequest(*, first_name: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=1), MaxLen(max_length=47)], last_name: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=1), MaxLen(max_length=47)], user_summary: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=4095)] = None)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Request schema for updating a user’s datan. Allows the update of a user’s first name, last name, and optional user summary. All fields are stripped of leading and trailing whitespace before being saved.
